interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Dr. Quinn Medicine Woman - The Complete Season One
Review Date: 2003/06/02
Store: Helene Udy  (Actor),     James Leland Adams  (Actor),     Terrence O'Hara  (Director),     Michele Lee  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, A&E Home Video, All A&E Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'From the moment that Dr. Michaela "Mike" Quinn (Jane Seymour) first stepped from the stagecoach into the mud of Colorado Springs, TV audiences had a new destination on Saturday nights.', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'won popular and critical acclaim--including five Emmy® awards--with its tales of courage, conviction and romance on the American frontier. When the show was cancelled after six seasons, it sparked one of the largest viewer protests in TV history.', "This comprehensive collector's set gathers all 17 episodes from the groundbreaking first season--plus a host of exclusive extras--on 5 DVDs. Old fans will delight in revisiting favorite moments, like Dr. Mike's first kiss from Sully (Joe Lando) and General Custer's visit to town, while newcomers will be captivated by the gripping, family-friendly stories and painstaking authenticity. Return to Colorado Springs for the unforgettable first season of Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, available for the first time on DVD!", 'Amazon.com', 'Season one of', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'captures the popular television series at its most charming and original: a gently feminist, 19th-century Western with mythic overtones, a', 'Gunsmoke', '-like vision of small-town constancy, and an audacious love story that might best be described as Buckskin Bronte. British actress Jane Seymour scrubbed away her accent to play Michaela Quinn, fifth daughter of a well-to-do Boston physician who encouraged her to get a medical degree despite social obstacles.', "The headstrong Quinn moves to rough-and-tumble Colorado Springs to set up a practice, faces stiff resistance from the locals, witnesses the brutality of white America's expansionism, and generally experiences a classic Western transformation from privilege to pioneering. Along the way, Quinn makes a heartfelt connection with the mysterious Sully (Joe Lando), a laconic outsider/cowboy-knight-errant/widower preserving his broken heart. While the series' pilot may be the best thing in this set, there is a lot to enjoy about further episodes (with such guest stars as Johnny Cash and Robert Culp) exploring Quinn's hard-won admiration from town skeptics.", 'Dr. Quinn', 'creator Beth Sullivan admirably balances the many influences and narrative forces at work; some of the best shows are idea-driven, such as "Portraits," which deals with prejudice.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance', 'Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Contributor': "James Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck BowmanJames Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck Bowman  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 3 inches; 1.1 Pounds', 'Director': "Terrence O'Hara, Michele Lee, Chuck Bowman, Jerry Jameson, James Keach", 'Media Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Run time': '14 hours', 'Release date': 'May 27, 2003', 'Actors': 'Helene Udy, James Leland Adams', 'Studio': 'A&E Home Video', 'Number of discs': '5'}
Review Text: I have always been a huge fan of Dr. Quinn from the moment in came on TV.  I have many of the episodes taped, but as any avid "tapers" will notice, over the years they get fuzzy, jumpy, etc.  I am so THRILLED that they have finally put these jewels on DVD!  I love the clean storytelling, and I love the new twist on the old west story.  Season One really starts the story line off with Dr. Mike and Sully, as well as shows Micheala's knack at being a mother.  I can watch these shows a million times, and I'm crossing my fingers that they release the rest of the seasons!
Review Title: Mad about Medicine Woman!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'From the moment that Dr. Michaela "Mike" Quinn (Jane Seymour) first stepped from the stagecoach into the mud of Colorado Springs, TV audiences had a new destination on Saturday nights.', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'won popular and critical acclaim--including five Emmy® awards--with its tales of courage, conviction and romance on the American frontier. When the show was cancelled after six seasons, it sparked one of the largest viewer protests in TV history.', "This comprehensive collector's set gathers all 17 episodes from the groundbreaking first season--plus a host of exclusive extras--on 5 DVDs. Old fans will delight in revisiting favorite moments, like Dr. Mike's first kiss from Sully (Joe Lando) and General Custer's visit to town, while newcomers will be captivated by the gripping, family-friendly stories and painstaking authenticity. Return to Colorado Springs for the unforgettable first season of Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, available for the first time on DVD!", 'Amazon.com', 'Season one of', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'captures the popular television series at its most charming and original: a gently feminist, 19th-century Western with mythic overtones, a', 'Gunsmoke', '-like vision of small-town constancy, and an audacious love story that might best be described as Buckskin Bronte. British actress Jane Seymour scrubbed away her accent to play Michaela Quinn, fifth daughter of a well-to-do Boston physician who encouraged her to get a medical degree despite social obstacles.', "The headstrong Quinn moves to rough-and-tumble Colorado Springs to set up a practice, faces stiff resistance from the locals, witnesses the brutality of white America's expansionism, and generally experiences a classic Western transformation from privilege to pioneering. Along the way, Quinn makes a heartfelt connection with the mysterious Sully (Joe Lando), a laconic outsider/cowboy-knight-errant/widower preserving his broken heart. While the series' pilot may be the best thing in this set, there is a lot to enjoy about further episodes (with such guest stars as Johnny Cash and Robert Culp) exploring Quinn's hard-won admiration from town skeptics.", 'Dr. Quinn', 'creator Beth Sullivan admirably balances the many influences and narrative forces at work; some of the best shows are idea-driven, such as "Portraits," which deals with prejudice.', '--Tom Keogh']

I have always been a huge fan of Dr. Quinn from the moment in came on TV.  I have many of the episodes taped, but as any avid "tapers" will notice, over the years they get fuzzy, jumpy, etc.  I am so THRILLED that they have finally put these jewels on DVD!  I love the clean storytelling, and I love the new twist on the old west story.  Season One really starts the story line off with Dr. Mike and Sully, as well as shows Micheala's knack at being a mother.  I can watch these shows a million times, and I'm crossing my fingers that they release the rest of the seasons!
Mad about Medicine Woman!
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** Strong affinity for classic television series, particularly those combining elements of romance, history, and strong character development. The user appreciates series that present unique twists on traditional narratives, specifically in a historical or Western context.

- **Viewing Behavior:** Enjoys watching family-friendly storytelling that emphasizes character growth and emotional connections, as indicated by their enthusiasm for the relationships portrayed in the series.

- **Nostalgia and Collecting:** Displays a penchant for nostalgia, highlighted by a desire to revisit beloved childhood shows. Values comprehensive collections, such as complete seasons of favorite series, appreciating the addition of exclusive content and extras.

- **Rating Pattern:** Tends to provide high ratings (e.g., 5.0) for products that resonate personally, suggesting a positive evaluation of quality and storytelling consistency.

- **Community Engagement:** Engages with shows that inspire strong viewer loyalty and community discussion, referencing significant fan following and viewer protests related to show cancellations, indicating an awareness of broader cultural impacts of these series.

Overall, this user shows a deep connection to heartwarming, character-driven narratives from iconic television history, revealing a preference for collecting and celebrating memorable storytelling.
